Easy-to-Get Items You'll Use


Granted, these items aren't easy for EVERYONE to get, but most of them are fairly low difficulty or just take a little time, and the rewards for these various quests or kills are well worth a little added effort. All yield nice items that are great to have; where possible, I've included tips for getting or recharging the item once its effect has been used up.

Reaper of the Dead - Procs: Complete Heal (single-charge). Who can use it: All/All (top inventory slot). How to get it: This item is the reward for the Neriak 'Thex Mallet' quest; at least until it is nerfed, all classes and races can use its complete heal effect by having the reaper equipped in the top inventory slot. VERY handy for you non-healing tank types. Tip: The finished reaper is not no-drop, so if you are not a race welcome in Neriak, make or have a friend make a newbie dark elf for running the various parts of the quest that require this faction, and have your main go along for escort and to do the more difficult parts of the quest. The reaper and mallet pieces ARE lore, so if you plan to get more than one, you'll have to do it two separate times, and keep one of the rewards on another character. Recharge Process: Unknown.

Star of the Eyes - Procs: Identify (unlimited charges). Who can use it: All/All (regular inventory slot, target self and right-click). How to get it: This is one of the first rewards for the 'Staff of the Wheel' quest. If you are a wizard, you would turn in the first staff and this star-ruby-looking item you receive, for the two runes needed for your 49th level spells. If you are one of the rest of us, you will destory the staff (wizard-only), keep the Star of the Eyes for its identification benefit, and say to heck with the runes. Tip: The rod pieces you need to collect for this quest spawn approximately every 20 minutes, so even if someone has come just before you, this quest can be run, with teleportation, in about 2 hours max. Try to lump the areas you need together, and bear in mind to hail the NPC in Everfrost LAST, since the box he gives you is no-rent. Recharge Process: N/A, unlimited charges.

Shiny Brass Idol - Procs: Divine Aura (invulnerability spell, single-charge). Who can use it: All/All (top inventory slot, right-click). How to get it: Our warrior uses these like candy, when pulling difficult areas. The great thing about these is that there is no associated quest; they are dropped in Highhold Pass from a level 20 named orc, Vopuk Shralok. The bad news is that they are lore, so take some friends and get one for everyone, if you want spares around. The idols are not no-drop (auctioning in HH also sometimes will get you one or two more). Tip: Spawn time on this mob is random, so take a tracker and be the first to nail the mob when he pops. Recharge Process: N/A, single charge uses up the item when cast.

Sacred Band of Rodcet Nife - Procs: Greater Heal (300hp heal, single-charge). Who can use it: All/All (right-click). How to get it: This is NOT the same ring as from the Frostbite quest. This ring is much easier to get, though have your main do the killing and let an alternate character or friend's newbie character do the looting and run the quest, since it is possible that only clerics and paladins will get this reward. Step 1: Be at the Temple of Life (spaceship-looking guild in North Qeynos) at 11:00 pm game time; a thief (approx level 15?) will shout to the zone and spawns directly in front of the spaceship ramp. He runs fast, so prepare to root and kill him (very low hp). The thief drops a Sacred Scroll of Nife. Step 2: Take the Sacred Sroll to the bar/inn near the South Qeynos docks at exactly 9:00 pm game time. An npc spawns there in the customer area of the bar itself (you'll know him, can't recall name). Give him the scroll, and he gives you this ring. Ring is lore, but not no-drop. Tip: This is a nice item for even higher-level casters, since 300hp makes a big difference in whether you live or die, in an emergency. Purported to be instant-cast. Recharge Process: Unknown, if any. It's possible the guild has an npc that will recharge, but probably just easier to get another.

Srathbone Anti-Venom - Procs: Abolish Poison (high-level cure poison spell, single-charge potion). Who can use it: All/All (right-click from inventory, 6 second cast). How to get it: This is dropped from various strathbone spiders in the Kaesora dungeon, located within the Field of Bone in Kunark. Tip: This zone is good for high-30s players, if you want to get experience with your reward. Potion is dropped fairly often, and is great for after those Trakanon battles, when nobody seems to have mana to cure your poison. Recharge Process: N/A, single-charge potion.

Kiola Juice - Procs: Light Healing (35hp heal, instant cast). Who can use it: All/All (right-click potion). How to get it: This item is purchasable at Sister Island in OOT and is not lore as far as I know. Tip: Not a lot of hit points, but great for that non-healing lowbie you have running around, or for mid-level casters trying to solo. The real benefit is that it is purchasable, so it isn't hard to get, and not lore, so you can carry more than one at a time. Recharge Process: N/A, single-charge potion.

Crystalline Silk Net - Procs: Ensnaring Roots (2 charges). Who can use it: All/All (right-click from main inventory). How to get it: This item drops off of Crystal Spiders (level 25-29), found both in Crystal Caverns and Thurgadin mines in the Velious expansion. Tip: Great for non-rooting classes to carry around for help in getting those pesky mobs off of you when you're in a hurry to get somewhere. Recharge Process: N/A, two charges and it's done.
